business.headline: Save up to Rs 2 lakh a year: Real estate tax hacks every investor should knowFor many Indians, property isn't just a place to live, it's a smart investment. But what often gets overlooked are the tax breaks that can make real estate even more rewarding.
Retail inflation rises marginally to 2.07% in August from 1.55% in JulyDespite edging up in August, inflation remains very low compared to recent years and well within the RBI's target range of 2–6%.

Sebi board meeting decisions in focus as markets rally for eighth straight sessionBut the bigger story now is what comes next from Sebi. The regulator's crucial board meeting is expected to decide on sweeping changes to futures and options trading.
Sensex closes 356 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; BEL gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 356 points to close at 81,904.70, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.50 points to end at 25,114.00.

Gen-Z vs millennial: Who is better at saving money?GenZ are painted as loud, brash spenders who splurge on gadgets, sneakers, and experiences over savings. But is that really true when it comes to accumulating savings?

Sebi meeting today: What can stock market investors expect from meeting?The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is expected to approve a set of reforms that aim to make the market more attractive for businesses and investors.

Giorgio Armani's will outlines gradual sale or IPO of fashion empireThe late Giorgio Armani has left behind more than just a fashion empire. His will reveals a carefully crafted plan for the future of his company. Here's what it says.

Gold hits record highs. 3 key reasons behind the rallyThe shine of gold is brighter than ever. Prices have soared to record levels, with global and domestic markets witnessing a strong rally. So, what's driving this rise? Three major factors are at play.

How seniors can unlock Rs 1.5 lakh a month from their home, explains expertRising medical bills and everyday expenses often strain retirees who have no pension. But for those who own a house, there's a way out. An expert says reverse mortgage can turn property into a monthly pension of Rs 1.5 lakh.

From income reporting to form selection: 7 must-do ITR stepsThis article outlines the key things taxpayers in India need to remember while filing their income tax return for the current assessment year, with a focus on accuracy, compliance, and timely processing.

Infosys shares up 2% on record buyback plan. Will existing shareholders benefit?Infosys shares climbed over 2% after the IT firm announced a Rs 18,000 crore buyback, the largest in its history. The offer, priced at a 19% premium, could benefit existing shareholders, though experts caution on execution challenges.
Dalal Street momentum: Top sectors to invest in todayExperts believe that from Q3 onwards, earnings should improve due to GST rationalisation and income tax cuts, which will start paying off.

Thinking of borrowing for your next foreign trip? Here's why you shouldn'tA surge in Indians borrowing for foreign trips raises financial concerns. CoinSwitch's founder offers insights into prudent financial practices to prevent potential debt accumulation.
Markets open higher on Fed rate cut optimism; Infosys leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 211.13 points to 81,759.86 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 66.665 points to trade at 25,072.15.

Explained: Why SIP investors on trading apps must check XIRR, not just returnsIn SIPs, investments enter the market at different times. Some stay for years, others only months. Absolute returns treat them alike, distorting the picture. XIRR offers a more accurate measure.

Urban Company IPO closes today. Is it a risky bet as GMP soars on last day?Urban Company's initial public offering ends its bidding phase today after strong investor interest and rising grey market premiums.

Gold touches new lifetime high of Rs 1.13 lakh per 10 grams in DelhiGold prices surged to a new lifetime high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams in Delhi on Thursday. The yellow metal has gained over 43% this year. Experts attribute the surge to central bank buying, exchange-traded funds inflows, and geopolitical tensions.

Zupee lays off 30% of staff as it adapts to India's Online Gaming ActZupee has rolled out a comprehensive relief package for employees affected by the layoffs. The support plan includes financial assistance beyond the standard notice period, with extra compensation based on years of service.
Will Diwali light up Dalal Street for investors?While the festival is often seen as a time for good fortune, experts say the stock market doesn't necessarily follow festive trends.
Rupee slides to all-time low as US tariffs biteThe Indian rupee hit a record low of 88.44 against the US dollar on Thursday, pressured by US tariffs and heavy foreign investor outflows.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains amid optimism over US-India trade dealThe NSE Nifty50 rose by 32.40 points to close at 25,005.5, while the BSE Sensex increased by 123.58 points, settling at 81,548.73.

UPS to NPS switch now allowed, but rules applyCentral government employees who opted for the UPS can now switch back to the NPS, the government has announced. However, this flexibility comes with specific rules and conditions that employees must follow.
Buying a phone on loan? Non-payment may lock your deviceCurrently, over one-third of consumer electronics, including mobile phones, are purchased on small-ticket loans in India.

Should you pay income tax with credit card? All you need to knowAs the tax filing deadline approaches, many taxpayers scramble to pay their dues. While net banking and UPI are common, using a credit card is also an option, but it comes with costs and benefits you should know.

Why even small income slips can trigger big tax notices, explains tax advisorThink a small slip in your tax return won't matter? Think again. Even missing Rs 5,000 bank interest has invited income tax notices. A tax advisor breaks down why AIS mismatches are a growing headache.

PF crisis: What makes withdrawing your own money so difficultFor decades, the Provident Fund has been seen as a loyal companion, quietly growing with every paycheque, waiting to support employees in tough times or after retirement. But when the time comes to withdraw it, many workers discover that accessing their savings is anything but simple.
Looking to invest in IT stocks? Here are the top picksDespite recent concerns around tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump in April, experts remain positive on the IT sector's future.

Denied in crisis: Inside a family's year-long battle to claim health insuranceFor Vipin Vishnu Ajayan and his family, the year-long fight for his father's treatment was more than paperwork. It meant sleepless nights, borrowed money, and unanswered calls. What should have been a safety net in a medical crisis turned into a draining battle that tested their strength, faith and dignity.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion salary vs the worldElon Musk's proposed $1 trillion compensation package from Tesla is drawing attention not only for its sheer size but also for the ambitious targets the world's richest person needs to fulfil.

World's richest race: Elon Musk reclaims No.1 spot from Larry EllisonElon Musk has largely remained at the top of the global wealth chart since first claiming the position in 2021. Though he was overtaken briefly by LVMH's Bernard Arnault in 2021 and by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 2024.

Donald Trump's hot-and-cold tariff game: Why India must avoid a 'MASALA' dealDonald Trump is giving India mixed signals on trade and tariffs, hot one moment and cold the next. The risk? Falling for MASALA deals. Read to know what they are, and why India must resist.
Sensex, Nifty gain after flat opening amid US rate cut optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 100 points after a flat start, while the NSE Nifty50 briefly crossed the 25,000 mark.

3 IPOs in focus: Urban Company leads, but where's the bigger listing gain?Urban Company's was fully subscribed within a few hours, indicating high demand. Alongside Urban Company, two other IPOs, Dev Accelerator and Shringar House of Mangalsutra, are also open for bidding this week.

Oracle's Larry Ellison surpasses Elon Musk to become world's richest personEllison's net worth jumped by an unprecedented $101 billion in a single day after Oracle Corp. delivered blowout quarterly results, sparking a record surge in its stock.

From 20s to retirement: How bonds strengthen your financesBonds don't grab headlines like stocks, but they quietly strengthen your finances across life stages. From building discipline in your 20s to ensuring stability in retirement, they remain a steady anchor for wealth creation. Here's how they work for you.
Document shows India resisting complete crypto regulation: ReportWhile some countries like Japan and Australia are developing frameworks to regulate digital assets carefully, India remains cautious.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains on US trade deal hopes and Fed rate cut buzzThe NSE Nifty 50 climbed 104.50 points to close at 24,973.10, while the BSE Sensex added 323.83 points, ending at 81,425.15. The Nifty has now gained for six straight sessions, with the Sensex rising in five of the last six trading days.

Festive season stocks that you should add to your portfolioWith people ready to spend on home appliances, beauty products, lifestyle goods, and automobiles, investors are now looking for stocks that could benefit from this surge in demand.

Is your credit score falling? Here's how to fix itHas your credit score recently taken a hit? You're not alone. Many people discover a drop only when applying for a loan or credit card. The good news is, most reasons are easy to fix with a few smart steps.

Fitch raises India's growth forecast to 6.9% for FY26 on strong Q2 performanceThe revision comes after India's real GDP grew by 7.8% in the April–to-June quarter, surpassing expectations and marking an acceleration from the 7.4% growth seen in the previous three months.

entertainment.headline: Ed Sheeran releases new album Play, dance-pop track Symmetry out nowEd Sheeran recently released his new album 'Play' featuring Indian and Persian musical influences. The album offers collaborations with producers and musicians from across the globe.

Do You Wanna Partner review: Tamannaah-Diana's beer drama is almost brew-tifulRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Do You Wanna Partner series review: Tamannaah Bhatia stars as Shikha, a woman reinventing herself through a craft beer startup. The series explores female ambition, jugaad, and fierce competition in a male-dominated industry.

Sufi Motiwala says outdated stereotypes of LGBTQ characters fuel societal stigmaInfluencer-turned-actor Sufi Motiwala expressed that there are hardly any projects being created where LGBTQIA artistes can tell their own stories. In an exclusive chat with India Today, he also discussed his acting debut in 'Do You Wanna Partner'.

Diljit Dosanjh gets emotional over Kantara 1 song-making, Rishab Shetty shows loveDiljit Dosanjh just treated fans to a rare, behind-the-scenes peek from 'Kantara: Chapter 1', sharing a warm and heartfelt video with actor-director Rishab Shetty. Shetty, overwhelmed with love, reacted to the post.

Diana Penty recalls Deepika Padukone as calm force, wishes Cocktail 2 team successDiana Penty recalls her debut film experience with Deepika Padukone as supportive and reassuring. She looks forward to Cocktail 2 and wishes the new cast success.

RGV praises Teja Sajja's Mirai for Hollywood-level VFX, compares it to BaahubaliDirector Ram Gopal Varma has praised Teja Sajja's fantasy-action thriller Mirai for its outstanding VFX and narrative. The film is being hailed as an industry hit, drawing comparisons to Baahubali and setting new standards.

Diana Penty reflects on ageism in Bollywood, women playing mothers in their 30sActor Diana Penty addressed the trend of women playing mothers in films during their 30s. She reflected on her approach to navigating the industry norms.

77th Primetime Emmy Awards: When and where to watch, nominations and presentersGet ready to binge on awards! From star-studded presenters to binge-worthy nominations, here's everything you need to know about this year's Emmy magic.

Varun Dhawan, Sonu Nigam dance to Bijuria at YouTube fan fest. Video goes viralActor Varun Dhawan and singer Sonu Nigam performed at the YouTube Fan Fest on the song 'Bijuria' from 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari.' 
A video of their performance is being widely shared on social media.

Kim Namjoon of BTS: A leader who leads by example, not dominationKim Namjoon, the leader of BTS, exemplifies true leadership with humility and emotional intelligence that resonates deeply with fans. His journey inspires many, showing how genuine reflection and growth can shape both art and people in today's world.

71st National Film Awards: SRK, Rani Mukerji to attend ceremony in New DelhiThe 71st National Film Awards are all set to roll out the red carpet for India's finest, with Shah Rukh Khan finally clinching his first National Award, and how! Alongside him, stars like Vikrant Massey and Rani Mukerji are ready to dazzle as the big night descends upon Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.

Kunickaa's old video on sexual abuse in industry goes viral, Kumar Sanu's son reactsSinger Kumar Sanu's son Jaan condemned 'Bigg Boss 19' contestant and actor Kunickaa Sadanand's remarks on rape in the film industry. A clip from an old interview is going viral, in which she suggested women give 'hints' to men.

Drishyam 3 director Jeethu Joseph warns fans not to expect another mind gameDirector Jeethu Joseph, in a recent interview, revealed that 'Drishyam 3' script has been completed. The filmmaker cautioned viewers against anticipating a complex thriller like previous instalments.

Turkish remake of Queen of Tears to premiere in SeptemberTurkish remake of 'Queen of Tears' titled 'Ask ve Gozyasi' stars Hande Ercel and Baris Arduc. The series is scheduled to premiere on ATV in September 2025.

Big show with superstar: Ashneer Grover's veiled jibe at Salman Khan and Bigg BossAshneer Grover calls for reality shows to prioritise contestants over hosts. His comments seemed like a veiled jibe at Salman Khan and 'Bigg Boss', which is hosted by the superstar.

Big jhappi to you: SRK thanks Diljit Dosanjh for supporting Aryan in singing debutShah Rukh Khan recently shared a heartwarming note for Diljit Dosanjh and expressed his gratitude for supporting his son Aryan Khan with his singing debut. Diljit and Aryan collaborated for the track 'Tenu Ki Pata' from 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Mirai X reviews: Teja Sajja's film gets thumbs up for divine cinematic experienceActor Teja Sajja's fantasy-action-thriller 'Mirai', received a highly positive response from viewers in their X reviews. The film was commended for its visuals, background score and divine references.

Exclusive: Demon Slayer star Sakurai finds India's Infinity Castle craze inspiring'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle' has created a cultural phenomenon in India, breaking advance booking records and thrilling fans with special midnight screenings. Voice actor Takahiro Sakurai spoke exclusively with India Today about his work.

general news.headline: Ex-Chief Justice Sushila Karki is Nepal's interim PM, first woman to get top jobSushila Karki held the first Cabinet meeting of her government and proposed holding fresh general elections on March 4, 2026.
Big deal to impose tariffs on India, causes rift with them, says TrumpBig deal to impose tariffs on India, causes rift with them, says Trump

Tyler Robinson, 22, arrested for shooting Charlie Kirk; family friend turned him in31-year-old Charlie Kirk was a staunch defender of gun rights and a key ally of Trump. He was fatally shot while addressing a crowd of over 3,000 at Utah Valley University.

Live: Nepal's interim government to impose emergency, security tightenedNepal Gen Z Protest Live: As Nepal slowly returns to normalcy, after days of violent protests led by Gen Z, the discussions about who will take charge of the nation have taken the centre stage. With the Nepal Army having imposed nationwide restrictions, names such as former Chief Justice Sushila Karki, Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, and former electricity board CEO Kulman Ghising are reportedly being considered to lead an interim government. 
India Today's Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are reporting from ground zero. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in

How the last Hindu kingdom fell to a violent Maoist movementAfter Gen Z–led protests toppled the Oli government, Nepal once again finds itself in the grip of political turmoil and violence. Just over 15 years ago, Nepal, once the world's last Hindu kingdom, where monarchs were revered as living deities, was transformed by a Maoist-led uprising.

Who's Tyler Robinson, arrested for shooting Charlie Kirk dead?Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old college dropout, has been arrested for shooting Charlie Kirk dead. Tyler is the son of a former sheriff department staffer, who turned him in to law enforcement. Here's all we know about Tyler Robinson from reliable sources.

Shooting outside Disha Patani's UP home, Goldy Brar gang claims responsibilityFiring was reported outside Bollywood actress Disha Patani's Bareilly home, with a threatening social media post claiming responsibility and warning the film industry. Police have launched an investigation and are verifying the post's authenticity.

Mic drop. Watch how lawyer destroyed Pakistan in 4 seconds at UNPakistan was called a state sponsor of terror by Hillel Neuer, a human rights lawyer, while the UN was discussing the recent Israeli attack in Qatar targeting Hamas leaders.

Gen Z protestors pick Nepal's next PM via Discord, what is DiscordNepal's anti-corruption protests led by Gen Z activists toppled the KP Sharma Oli government. Now, Gen Z is using the US-based social media app Discord to decide on the country's next leader.

Trump wants the oil business that India is giving to Russia. War talk is pretenceTrump's India envoy pick, Sergio Gor, said the US wanted India to open its market to exports of American oil and petroleum products. It suggests that Trump means business and only business.

PM Modi to visit Manipur tomorrow, will meet victims of 2023 violenceTwo years after ethnic clashes rocked Manipur, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is all set to visit the northeastern state to inaugurate development projects. The visit will pave the way for peace, normalcy, and growth in the state, said state Chief Secretary.

86 killed after boat capsizes in Congo due to 'improper loading': ReportThe boat accident in Congo occurred on Wednesday, according to the state media, which also reported that most of the victims were students.

Delhi's plan to microchip stray dogs is illegal, costly, and uselessDelhi's stray dog microchip plan faces tough questions; global data shows 37 per cent failure, up to 70 per cent inefficiency, Rs 1,700 per dog cost vs Rs 150 vaccinations, only 26 per cent success in UK, and 10–12 per cent missed scans. Activists call it wasteful.

iPhone 17 Buying Guide: 17 Pro to iPhone Air, which one should you get?Like every other year, we again have four new iPhones — the iPhone 17, the iPhone 17 Pro, the iPhone Air and the iPhone 17 Pro Max. But unlike previous years, this time choosing between one over another is not easy because each seems to be meant for a specific set of users.
If vote chori continues..: Akhilesh Yadav warns of Nepal-like unrest in IndiaThe Samajwadi Party chief said that people may take to streets like those in Nepal if 'vote chori' did not stop in India.

Get a taste of your own medicine: Top lawyers clash in Sunjay Kapur assets caseKarisma Kapur's children, Samaira and Kiaan, have filed a lawsuit seeking a share in their late father, Sunjay Kapur's estate, while accusing his widow Priya Sachdeva of withholding documents and critical details about his will.

5,00,000-km-wide butterfly-shaped hole pops up on the SunNasa's Solar Dynamics Observatory has photographed a massive butterfly-shaped coronal hole on the Sun. Solar wind from the hole is set to reach Earth by 14 September, possibly causing geomagnetic storms.

Chased, beheaded, dumped: Indian man killed in front of family at US motelThe accused used a machete to fatally attack 50-year-old Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah after an argument at the motel in Dallas. The victim was killed in front of his wife and son.
No big deal, vote chori main issue: Rahul Gandhi on PM's upcoming Manipur visitPM Modi is to visit Manipur on Saturday for the first time since the ethnic violence started in the state in 2023.

Bihar teen who left home at 14 is only Indian finalist for Global Student Prize 2025From leaving home at 14 in Champaran, Bihar, to serving as a Google Youth Advisor and mentoring global competitions, Adarsh Kumar has transformed his journey into one that builds opportunities for countless students through fellowships, startups, and grassroots change. He is now the only Indian finalist (chosen from over 11,000 candidates) in the Global Student Prize 2025, the 'student Nobel Prize' which comes with Rs 87 lakh ($100,000).
Priyanka Chopra's week in Ralph Lauren and Dior in NYCTwo days, two fashion houses, and Priyanka Chopra at the centre of it all, slaying every look. Read more here.

Russia pauses peace talks with Ukraine, accuses Europe of obstructionRussia said peace talks with Ukraine are on pause, blaming Europe for obstruction, while Putin signalled willingness for dialogue but warned of using force if needed.

sports.headline: Asia Cup: Sanju Samson is good enough to bat any number, says batting coachIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has said that wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson is versatile and can bat at any position in the lineup. He also confirmed on Friday that, although Samson has not regularly featured at No. 5 or 6, he is ready to embrace the challenge.

Rajat Patidar slams hundred in Duleep Trophy final, flaunts Test aspirationsDuleep Trophy final: Rajat Patidar struck a decisive century to put Central Zone in a dominant position against South Zone in the summit clash, continuing his fine domestic form after leading RCB to their maiden IPL title.

Manchester City boss ready to adapt to new keeper Donnarumma after Ederson's exitManchester City manager Pep Guardiola said that Gianluigi Donnarumma is a different type of goalkeeper than their former first-choice Ederson, and he would not expect the Italian to replicate his predecessor's role at the club.

IPL chairman cites government's position on IND vs PAK clash amid boycott callsIPL chairman Arun Dhumal wished Team India good luck ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 clash with Pakistan. The two teams are set to lock horns on September 14 in Dubai.

Lakshya Sen ends Ayush Shetty's dream run, storms into semifinalsHong Kong Open 2025: Lakshya Sen outclassed 20-year-old Ayush Shetty in an all-Prakash Padukone Academy quarter-final on Friday. Shetty's dream run at the Super 500 tournament came to an end after a fine campaign that included a stunning win over World No. 7 Kodai Naraoka of Japan in the previous round.

Amorim explains Onana's departure, confirms starting keeper for Manchester derbyManchester United manager Ruben Amorim has addressed Andre Onana's exit, clarified his goalkeeping plans for the derby, and confirmed a trio of injury absences ahead of the clash with City.

Sourav Ganguly has great cricketing brain, will beat pressure in SA20: Allan DonaldSourav Ganguly may face pressure in his first SA20 coaching stint, but legendary Allan Donald believes his "fantastic cricket brain" will help him navigate the tough moments.

Will walk around naked if Joe Root doesn't score 100 in Ashes 2025-26: HaydenMatthew Hayden has vowed to walk naked around the MCG if Joe Root fails to score a century in the Ashes 2025-26. Root is yet to score a century in Australia, having played 27 Test innings in the country.

Nikki Bella teases reunion with AJ Lee after WWE return sparks nostalgiaAJ Lee's surprise return has ignited excitement across the WWE Universe, while Nikki Bella's hints at a possible reunion are stirring both nostalgia and fan anticipation.

New Suns guard Jalen Green named among NBA's most overpaid playersJalen Green has been labeled one of the NBA's most overpaid players after signing a $105.3 million deal with the Phoenix Suns, leaving the team to gamble on his development alongside Devin Booker.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
